dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A screaming face.  Whirling lights.  A local carnival.  T small-town traveling kind. SUPER:  THREE YEARS LATER. Up on the ferris wheel, a bunch of JUNIOR HIGH SCHOOL BOY are distinguishing themselves by hurling water balloons d at carnival-goers.  Among the participants is Faith's bro Larry. PULL DOWN from them to "MADAME DIVINA'S FORTUNE TELLING BOOTH". "Know Your Fate".  Clustered in front of it are a bunch of JUNIOR HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS. We should recognize Faith as one of them.  Another girl, LESLIE, is egging a friend on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, go on... (to the rest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to know if she's gonna marry Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not.  I'm not gonna marry Alex. (obviously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't even have a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's got pretty eyes.  That means your kids would have pretty eyes.  You can always get a car later, but you can't always find pretty eyes.  You gotta think ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares about pretty eyes, Leslie?  I'm telling you, stocks, bonds, real estate -- that's what you wanna look for in a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the voice of authority)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely sex. Somebody else pipes up,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom told me you gotta want the same things out of life.  Have the same values, be able to communicate. They all turn to look blankly at this poor, misguided sou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just telling you what she said. They're still looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like I believed her or anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think the most important thing is, Faith? There is not a doubt in her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True love.  I believe there's one special person out there who's meant for each of us.  And when your eyes meet, it'll be magic and you'll both know it instantly. A couple of dissenters roll their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to another friend)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think so, Kate? KATE's looking at the ground, trying to sound casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I guess I never really thought about it... (in her next breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Larry here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she couldn't care less)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  He's around somewhere. Up above, Larry takes careful aim, then sends a water bal torpedoing their way.  It hits the ground between them wi an enormous SPLAT.  They SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move past them, through a beaded window and into the b where a disheveled older WOMAN, MADAME DIVINA, is paging through a copy of "Scientific American". There's a TAP at the door.  She checks her watch.  Curses She shoves the magazine in a drawer, then hoists a bowlin ball, the kind with the iridescent swirls in them, onto a opening in the center of the table, carefully positioning so the three holes aren't visible.  She flicks on a flash above it.  Crystal ball. Back outside, the girl everybody-thinks-is-going-to-marry is nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if she tells me something bad?  I don't want to hear anything bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never tell you anything bad. Nobody'd ever go to them if they did. The door opens.  The WOMAN'S imposing hulk casts a shadow over them.  They look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knocked? Like deer in the headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at Kate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at girl #2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did. Nobody moves, until,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. Faith looks at her friends, shrugs, then gamely ventures inside past the beads and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighting a candle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you wanna know, Faith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, just basic destiny stuff, I guess.  But-- I don't want to hear anything bad. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's okay. Madame Divina starts laying out a series of tarot cards. Suddenly there's a loud KNOCK at the back door.  Faith ju

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spirits. She lays down a couple more cards.  Then a persistent "PSSSSTTTT", "PSSSSTTT".  More BANGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hollering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, I'm outta change. More KNOCKING.  Harry is determined.  Annoyed, Mme.  Divi finally gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come I always wind up next door to the freak show? (as she goes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because they're midgets does that mean they don't have to go to the bank like the rest of us? She lumbers to the back of the booth, throws open a back and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Inside, Faith is nervously eying the cards.  Her friend K peeks in through the beads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing the words and pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a bowling ball? Faith doesn't understand.  Kate mimes a bowling motion, swinging her arm.  Faith shrugs.  As the woman returns, f outside we overhear,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Kate.  Larry wants you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not. Kate grins, ducks out.  Mme. Divina sits back down.  Clos her eyes.  Fingers the ball, entranced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something is coming to me.  I'm getting... a name. Faith leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This name is very important to you...  Da--  David.  No-- no... A faint breeze flutters through the room and the candle s to flicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon. Faith's heart skips a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is... (her eyes pop open with startling intensity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon Bradley. It is, of course, the same name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod.  Omigod. (getting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go. She seizes Faith's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute-- Faith freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your destiny's two dollars. Faith pulls out two bills, drops them on the table.  Bolt for the door.  But the woman stops her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-- She leans in very close and pulls Faith toward her.  We s sense that this is not part of the act.  This is for real

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is, no matter what the cards say, you make your own destiny.  Don't wait for it to come to you.  You understand? Faith nods.  Still in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I be excused now?

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: We hear pouring rain.  But what sounds like rain is actua the shower, as we pull back to find Mitzi Gaynor washing man right out of her hair.  "SOUTH PACIFIC" is on televis We pull back even further to reveal three WOMEN watching. A big Saturday night.  There's a lot of chocolate on the table. The women are:  the adult FAITH.  Attractive, a little dr The walls of her apartment are adorned with reproductions famous works all featuring a similar theme, Rodin's "The Kiss", Botticelli's "Birth of Venus", etc.  Bookshelves a crammed with volumes of poetry.  She's absentmindedly pul the petals off a bouquet of flowers on the table. Also in attendance: KATE, her childhood friend turned housewife and sister-in-law.  Kate is a pragmatist.  She' clipping coupons out of the newspaper as they watch.  And doing her nails, LESLIE.  Big hair.  Good heart.  Not the sharpest tool in the shed. As the movie cuts to a commercial,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying I think it would be a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dubiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Date police...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  A guy who says he's gonna call, then doesn't, ought to get slapped with a citation, that's all. Faith glances at Kate.  They're used to Leslie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing on her nails)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, like I said, I've given it a lot of thought and I've finally narrowed it down. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heterosexual with a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't think it's asking too much to want to feel it in my head and my heart and my body and my soul all at the same time, and to have that feeling to be mutual. Pass the M&Ms please. Her friends groan.  They're used to Faith.  Kate hands th candy over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as long as you're not hoping to find it on planet Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie's right, Faith.  You've got to start being more practical. Do you know what the statistics are, the marriage odds for women your age?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in statistics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an accountant for cryin' out loud. Faith holds out both palms, gesturing that her point has made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that guy you work with, Mike what's-his-name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the other one?  His friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just moved in with his girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about that guy at the bank? Faith pops another M&M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scientologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deflated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you gotta be a little flexible. Look at your brother and me. Larry's not perfect, neither am I.  But we work it out.  We're not unrealistic in our expectations, and we have each other. (setting down her scissors)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you've got the Door Number Three Syndrome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me, Oprah did a show--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I saw that.  Like on Let's Make A Deal.  You've got the Amana freezer and you can keep it, or risk it on what's behind Door Number Three.  Which usually turns out to be a donkey. Faith looks at Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have an Amana freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a metaphor.  It's women who always think there's some unknown out there that's going to be better than what's in front of them.  And instead wind up with nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metaphorically, I still don't have an Amana freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think if you're honest with yourself, you'll admit you've had a chance at a number of Amana appliances in your lifetime. She knows there's probably some ugly truth to this.  Luck the PHONE RINGS.  Faith picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Hi, Larry. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's here.  Hold on. (turning to Kate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LARRY, Kate's husband, Faith's brother, is at the kitchen table, munching the last crumbs out of a bag of potato ch and watching television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, you're still there?  I thought you'd be on your way home by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miss me?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.  Sure. (gazing forlornly into the refrigerator)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, did you forget the guys are coming over tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helplessly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's nothing here to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the movie, we hear yelling -- Kate's half of the fig -- in the background.  Then the SLAMMING of the receiver. When she comes back into the room, the "Some Enchanted Evening" number is on.  Faith is mouthing the words.  Kat starts picking up her coupons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (glancing at the tv, annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know all the shrinks on Donahue say that all those love songs about some enchanted evening are just a cruel hoax that feeds people's fantasies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little plaintive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But somebody wrote those songs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just that they came out of somebody's experience is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Faith.  They came out of somebody's imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith walks her friends to the door, opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you didn't have to go so early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, Larry and his friends are hungry. (relenting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I did say I'd try to pick something up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I told Ted I'd be home later if he wanted to stop by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said you thought he had a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, after that. As they talk, a slight GUY, one who might best be describ as, well, non-descript, walks by and heads into his apart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty well, Dwayne.  How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't complain. He closes his door.  Kate looks at Faith.  Who shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he gay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, he's not my type. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me walk you to the elevator. They walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have any idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a podiatrist or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's no chemistry there, okay?  There's no... thrill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Thrills"?  That's what you're waiting for?  You know how long that lasts?  Besides, how do you know?  Have you ever been out with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He's never asked me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I ask someone out who I don't want to go out with in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you've never been out with him, how do you know you don't want to go out with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost more to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he was kinda cute... Faith sighs.  Mercifully, the elevator doors finally open Kate and Leslie get in.  As the doors close,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a chance, Faith...  None of us is getting any younger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith re-enters her apartment.  The answering machine lig is blinking.  She plays the message back as she gets read for bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, honey.  It's Mom.  I just wanted to apologize if I upset you at brunch today. To herself in the bathroom mirror,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you upset me at brunch today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For upsetting you at brunch today. Now, you know I don't think you're a failure.  And if you never get married, that's perfectly fine with your father and me. Faith is applying eye cream.  She leans in closer, carefu examining the lines around her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you're not a freak. You're right, plenty of people aren't married. (trying to be supportive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy who cuts my hair isn't married.  Hey...  maybe you tw-- (a voice in the background)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gay. (her mother)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Never mind.  Anyway, if you want to spend the rest of your life alone, well, that's your choice. And I respect it.  I just want you to be happy, that's all. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, your Dad wants to say something. (male voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good fruit salad today, Faith. (Mom takes the phone back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk to you soon, sweetie. The machine shuts off.  Faith gets into bed.  Reaches for light.  Then, remembering something, gets up. There's a daily calendar lying on her dresser.  She rips the top page, crumples it into a ball, drops it into the wastebasket. And turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast audience of PEOPLE, all clad in ridiculous get-ups Faith is wearing a chicken suit.  Her Mother is there, in octopus costume.  Kate and Larry are Siamese twins.  Lesl is dressed as a radish.  MONTY HALL steps up to Faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, which one is it gonna be, Faith?  Will it be... Door Number One?... DWAYNE, the podiatrist, peeks out from between the curtai of Door Number One.  Waves.  The CROWD goes WILD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door Number Two?... The distinct BRAYING of a DONKEY can be heard emanating f behind Door Number Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Door Number Three?... A complete mystery.  This one seems to glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chanting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take Dwayne!  Take Dwayne! CAROL MERRILL is running an arm sensuously along Door Num One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door Number Three? Murmurs of dismay ripple through the crowd.  The curtains part. To reveal a shriveled OLD CRONE, covered in cobwebs who bears an unsettling resemblance to Faith.  The crowd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith shoots up in bed, in a cold sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith exits her apartment and heads down the hall, carryi a wastebasket.  She opens the garbage chute, lifts up the basket, but as she tilts it, her hand slips and a multitu of crumpled little balls, all those days, go spilling out the floor.  She just stares down at them, on the edge.  W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need some help? She looks up.  It's Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do... SLOW FADE TO BLACK. It's on a little BRIDE AND GROOM atop a massive wedding c rotating to an endless loop of "We've Only Just Begun".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it's settled. Pull back to reveal Faith on the other side of the bakery case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one, in vanilla.  He wants vanilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Larry are dressed up.  Driving through a thunderstorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the last one before the wedding, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we didn't have to bring another present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A party.  Champagne corks POP, MUSIC plays, GUESTS circul We move around the room, picking up snatches of conversat Dwayne is leading Faith around by the hand.  Thrusting he ring finger into people's faces. She's embarrassedly playing along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  Six grand.  Can you believe what they get for these things?  I'm telling you, it's highway robbery. He pats her ass proprietarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's worth it. Her mother watches, beaming.  Other elderly RELATIVES com up to her, offering their congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, to her mother)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd almost given up hope, dear. In another corner,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only is it tacky, it's exploitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not exploitation.  These people wanna sell and I wanna buy. How are golf clubs exploitation? (to a woman nearby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes one night class and suddenly she's a socialist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sociologist.  And because. (ticking them off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pawn shops are just like prostitutes, farm auctions and coal miners.  They're all for sale, but none of 'em would be if they weren't desperate for the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all desperate for the money, doll.  That's what made this country great. (to the woman again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back me up on this Candy, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me doll, Larry.  I hate it when you call me doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to love it when I called you doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it differently then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne's got a captive audience and is holding court near front door.  Faith is across the room, a tray of food in hands.  The DOORBELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm not kidding.  All over the metatarsus.  Corns the size of your fist-- and this fungus... (searching)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the way tuna fish looks when it's been in the back of the refrigerator for about six months? Anyway-- His listeners start silently returning their hors d'oeuvr to the serving trays.  The doorbell RINGS some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Faith)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, could you get that?  I'm in the middle of a story here-- Faith sets down the tray.  Goes to the door.  Outside is Leslie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late.  I was waiting for a phone call. Faith welcomes her in, introduces her to some other guest Larry comes over to congratulate his sister, gives her a As he walks away,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (contemptuously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begged me to marry him.  I didn't even want to marry him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not unkindly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I wouldn't've if I hadn't thought I was in love. Off her look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tricked me.  He was really fun back then.  And he was so cute... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was I supposed to know that ten years down the road he'd turn out to be an idiot? Dwayne pops his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hon-ey, picture time. Faith gets up to follow him.  As they go, he turns to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna leave your hair like that? Her hair looks exactly as it has all evening.  But she's anxiously trying to somehow rearrange it as the FLASH POP and the FRAME FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party's over.  They're saying goodnight to the few remaining guests.  The door closes one last time.  Faith starts cleaning up, picking up plates, etc.  Dwayne's sta in the bedroom doorway, unbuttoning his shirt, already ge ready for bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was really nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did a terrific job, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting his arms around her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just think...  This is only the beginning. He kisses her forehead.  Releases her.  Heads for the bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sweetie, you won't forget to pick up my cleaning tomorrow, will you? She starts to respond, but-- he's already disappeared.  A distant roll of thunder rumbles through the room.  The candlelight flickers.  And the rain descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of white, with a tiny face drowning in it.  Massive sleeves, an enormous hoop skirt, tiers of cascading ruffl drenched in acres of white sequins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like the Good Witch of the North. Kate's helping Faith try on her gown and veil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, it's not so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look how big it makes me look. (she looks down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look like an Alp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it was sweet of him to pick it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...  It was. Kate positions the veil on her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know.  I guess it's just not quite the way I always thought it was going to be.  You know, like in the movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the problem.  When you're a kid you think life is gonna be like the movies.  Dreams come true, the good guys win, people live happily ever after... all that crap.  Turn. She turns.  Kate continues adjusting the veil, pinning it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But one day you wake up and realize you've been had.  Of course life isn't like the movies.  That's why there are movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I guess you're right. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really like the wallpaper we picked out for the den. But Kate's just getting warmed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something about love.  There are no prince charmings, there are no glass slippers.  Love is hard work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People have problems, insecurities, flaws-- and you have to learn to compromise, to overlook, to forgive.  It's not settling, Faith, it's life.  Real life. Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, Kate. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think of this garter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (careening out of control)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, just how long are you going to cling to this childish illusion that it's all supposed to be perfect?  Well, guess what?... It isn't.  Not for you, not for anybody. Kate slams the pins down, scattering them.  A long beat o silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, is something the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakily, staring up at the ceiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry brought me flowers last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that bad?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's having an affair. She buries her face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're sitting down.  Faith is handing Kate kleenex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Now.  Have you talked to him about this? Still looking down, Kate mutely shakes her head, "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen him with someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...  I can just tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all, he is my brother, and I know he can be kind of a jerk sometimes, but I know him pretty well, and I really don't think-- The PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move. Faith gets up and tries to head into the kitchen, but the unfortunate combination of the big dress and the small do stop her.  She tries a variety of approaches before final turning the hoop skirt on an angle and suspending part of over her head, enabling her to squeeze through the doorwa just far enough to knock the receiver off the hook and gr it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? There's a lot of noise on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Is anybody there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder, over the noise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne Pinsley?  I'm trying to reach Dwayne Pinsley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in at the moment.  Can I take a message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to wrench herself free from the doorway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is his fiancee.  Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.  I'm an old high school buddy of Dwayne's.  I was in town this weekend, was hoping to stop by and surprise him. But I've gotta catch a plane so I'm afraid I'm not gonna be able to make it. Kate, wiping her eyes, mouths "who is it?"  Faith shakes head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wanting to get off the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he'll be sorry to hear that.  Who should I tell him called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's (lots of noise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hardly hear you.  Could you spell that? Kate hands Faith a pencil and the back of an RSVP card. letter by letter, we watch Faith scrawl out a name which, the second time in the movie, we realize spells "Damon Bradley". The receiver clatters to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumbstruck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon Bradley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Thanks a lot.  And congratulations.  It's not easy finding love these days. He's about to hang up.  She's shaken out of her stupor. the phone up off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAIT!!  Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at the airport.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-- in case Dwayne wants to try to reach you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he'd have to hurry.  My flight leaves at four o'clock. She checks her watch.  It's 3:15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like a shot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my way to Venice.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anything to keep him on the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venice?  I love Venice.  With the boats, right?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  Uh, yeah-- I've gotta run. Tell Dwayne hi.  Maybe someday we can all get together. Click.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But wait--  Hello?  Hello?? But there is only a dial tone.  She stands there clinging desperately to the receiver.  A woman adrift in a life ra who's suddenly seen a ship appear, then disappear back ov the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith, still in her wedding gown, is racing to her car. crazed gleam in her eye.  Kate is tagging after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman at my dry cleaners believes there's no such thing as coincidence. Kate looks at her.  So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathlessly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, but don't you think it's a weird coincidence?  Doesn't it seem like somebody's trying to tell me something?  And not only that, take a look at this... Faith pulls a clipped copy of the day's horoscope from he purse.  Kate scans the column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taurus: "Today can be a fresh start and a new beginning." (dropping it to her side)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Faith, they all say that. In my case it means I'm gonna empty the dishwasher. She snatches back the paper, undeterred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to get a look at him, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is driving like a maniac, her hoop skirt crammed in the edge of the dash, blocking the lower half of the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith screeches to a halt in the passenger loading zone, somehow manages to muscle the round hoop into an ellipse, springs out the door. She mashes herself into one of those glass-partitioned revolving doors, but gets stuck, making a few revolutions before a couple of PASSERS-BY help pry her out on the oth side. She scans a departure screen for the flight to Venice and buttonholes a SKY CAP.  He points to the distance. She hikes up her gown and starts sprinting through the airport, jumping luggage, can-can-ing through the turnsti dodging kids, running up the down escalator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith flings herself across the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathlessly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flight 417.  Is it still here? The CLERK gives her the once-over.  He hasn't seen this p in awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see your boarding pass, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-- I must've misplaced it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but without a boarding pass we can't let you on the plane. She starts digging through her purse, at the same time sl inching her way past the little rope they put up to block people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I've got it here someplace... He smiles back.  And tightens the rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  Because, like I said, until you find it, we can't let you on the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panic rising in her voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.  The man I'm supposed to marry is on that plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, ma'am, just a moment. He picks up his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this is Mario over at Alitalia. (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a 237 on our hands here. Uh huh.  Yeah.  Thanks. He hangs up.  The engines can be heard revving outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to her with a plastic smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be just a moment. We see a SECURITY GUARD approaching.  The Clerk starts wa him over.  Meanwhile, CREW MEMBERS off an arriving flight entering through a side door.  Using her dress as a shiel Faith manages to wedge a foot in it. As the clerk turns to address the guard, she darts out an starts sprinting across the tarmac for the plane--  where they've just finished pulling the portable stairs away fr the cabin door. As the plane starts to taxi, the GROUND CONTROLLER waves frantically at her to get out of the way.  With an anguis cry, she sinks to the ground as the jet SCREAMS overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a shooter of tequila.  A white-gloved hand picks up and downs it.  When,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, where's the nut in the dress? The BARTENDER casts a sympathetic glance towards the end the bar.  Points.  She's a pitiful figure, this bride in torn wedding gown getting bombed all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking her by the arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, ma'am, we agreed not to press charges.  But I'm afraid we're gonna have to ask you to leave. The bartender turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you drive?  Do you want us to call you a cab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not at all fine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.  I'm fine. She gets up shakily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we better call you a cab. (picking up the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it you want to go? Her eyes drift to the DEPARTURE SCREEN.  There's another flight leaving for Venice in one hour.  And a sudden ligh in her eyes. Kate is on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're afraid to fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is at a pay phone.  Feeling no pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my New Year's resolution to overcome it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's July.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still the new year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have vacation time coming to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where you're wrong.  I got one nine years ago.  I just never had an opportunity to use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you were afraid to fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you stop saying that?  I need you to do me a really big favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Dwayne know about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.  I told him I was going to visit a great aunt.  And don't tell Larry, either. Kate glances disdainfully over at Larry, who's engrossed the Home Shopping Club in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I tell him?  I'm not even speaking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Leslie are there.  Kate knocks.  No answer.  She pulls a key from beneath the mat and opens the door. She calls out Dwayne's name.  No answer.  Nods to Leslie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith, still in her bridal gown, is waiting impatiently a the TWA terminal entrance.  Finally, she spots Kate and L in the distance, carrying a suitcase.  She rushes to them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously to Leslie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you able to find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the very bottom of Dwayne's closet. Faith clenches her fist in victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...  there wasn't a regular yearbook picture of him in there. He must've been absent that day or something. Faith's face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, he was in the marching band. Faith brightens again, as Leslie pulls a contact lens cas from her purse.  She unscrews one side, empties the conte into Faith's palm.  A fuzzy little image the size of an eraserhead.  Damon Bradley, age 17, in the shadow of a tu Faith holds the virtually microscopic black and white spe up under her nose, examining it lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Leslie. Then, ever so carefully, places it back into the case, pu the case in her purse, and reaches for her suitcase.  Whi Kate is still holding onto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we did this.  Do I have to remind you that your wedding is in six days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know you think this is irresponsible of me, but think how much more irresponsible it would be to marry the wrong person. (more) FAITH  (Cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if Dwayne and I aren't really meant to be?  Is it fair of me to waste his life? Kate reluctantly lets go.  Faith starts walking through t terminal, pulling clothes from the suitcase. They follow her into the ladies' room, where Faith change clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's right.  You shouldn't let a chance like this slip by. What if he's really The One?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les-lie, he's not The One.  She's never even met this man. (to Faith)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean to tell me that you've spent your whole life waiting for somebody with this name-- (qualifying it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: this name you got from a Parker Brothers game when you were eleven--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I haven't.  And you forgot about the fortune teller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, you have... Faith hands her gown and car keys to Leslie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just going to fly to Italy and start combing the streets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling a cocktail napkin from her purse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was on his way to Venice, right? I called the tourist bureau and I must've called every hotel in the city, but I found where he's staying. (more) FAITH  (Cont'd) (giddy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I've made a reservation. Kate shakes her head.  They exit out of the restroom and towards her gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even know what he looks like.  You don't speak the language.  You don't know your way around.  This is a total stranger, in a foreign land. She's starting to get a little caught up in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A foreign land full of millions of Italian men...  speaking Italian with Italian accents and those huge brown eyes and that silky olive skin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How hard can it be?  I'll land there, I'll go to his hotel, I'll introduce myself, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live happily ever after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Off Kate's look,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, until today, I had forgotten all about this.  And chances are I'll find out he's not for me and I'll come home and marry Dwayne and never bring this up again. But    what if this is the real thing, Kate?  What if this is the real real thing? She steps aboard the escalator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish me luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie is behind the wheel of Faith's car, driving it hom Kate is at the wheel of her station wagon, driving it bac home.  When at the last opportunity to recircle the airpo Kate suddenly cuts the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a Let's Go, Italy guide, an Italian-English Dictionary, and a copy of How to Make a Man Fall in Love You}.  Faith is waiting at the gate.  She's packing the b into her suitcase when the glitter of her ENGAGEMENT RING catches her eye.  She looks around, before furtively slid it off.  She opens the coin purse of her wallet and is pl it inside, when a pair of shoes appear in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you loan me some clothes? Startled, she looks up.  Kate is standing there, holding passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep it in the glove compartment in case of emergencies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming with me? Kate nods.  Faith throws her arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying I think it's a good idea.  But if you're going to insist on doing this, I don't think you should go alone.  You need to be sensible about it. Their flight is announced.  They get up and start walking towards the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  The key is to go about this sensibly.  Logically. Rationally. As they go,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I tell you I figured out we both have the same number of letters in our names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the plane slowly taxis, the FLIGHT ATTENDANTS go throu their standard litany of disaster.  As usual, everybody i ignoring them.  Except for one passenger, who is looking slightly green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  I'm fine.  I don't know why I never did this before.  I mean, what's the big deal? The plane starts picking up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for the fact that I could lose my job. The landscape is beginning to blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could lose Dwayne. They're rocketing down the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly clutching Kate's arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid to fly. The ear-splitting SHRIEK of a jet engine as the plane tak off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women enter the terminal.  Kate is jet-lagged and little dazed.  Faith is like a kid on Christmas morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here, we're here, we're here! I can't believe we're really here. As they make their way to the baggage claim they're insta subjected to the Italian male's tendency to treat every f in sight as if she were the first woman he'd ever seen in life.  Faith looks around ingenuously,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what?...  It seems like there's a lot more available men in Italy. Kate rolls her eyes, grabs Faith by the elbow and steers out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our first view of Italy which, visually, is meant to be idealized.  A place where the light is always golden, and streets are full of magic and romance.  It's not the real Italy, it's the Italy of guidebooks.  Of memories and dreams... They stand at the edge of the docks which lead to the flo city.  Faith looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The book said they have boats that are like taxis... (scans LET'S GO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaporettos. (looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the name of the place we're staying again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully pulling out the cocktail napkin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called... the Gritty Palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Gritty"?  Is this gonna be one of those youth hostel dives jammed with backpackers who don't believe in deodorant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...  Maybe.  Think of it as an adventure. Faith spots a vaporetto.  As they dash towards it, somebo pinches Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!  What the-- She looks behind her.  The only person in the immediate vicinity is a NINE-YEAR-OLD BOY, looking innocent.  She W him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cretin. They step aboard just as the boat takes off, and Faith ga out into the distance, leaning out across the railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look Kate, look how beautiful... And it is...  as they sail toward the splendor that is Ve at twilight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic hour.  They float past ancient pallazi, their crumb facades rejuvenated in the gentle evening light.  Gondoli glide by.  Candlelit windows cast shimmering patches of g down onto the water.  It's just like the movies...  Event the DRIVER calls out,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gritti Palace. Faith can barely contain herself as they pull up alongsid one of the most elegant and expensive hotels in Venice. Former home to Hemingway and Maugham.  Dock lanterns glow beckoning them into its sumptuous surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is pretty ni-iice... Kate smiles, then realizes,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Faith's arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a Lifestyles hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Of the Rich and Famous".  Of which we are neither.  Are you out of your mind?  We can't afford this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up at it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (folding her arms)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cathy Lee Crosby stayed here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're here.  And more importantly, he's here. (stepping forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll cut back on everything else. She thanks the driver.  Pays him.  Steps off the boat.  K doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate.  It's one night. She still doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take credit cards. She's a statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get frequent flyer miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the elegant lobby of the restored 15th century palazzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad I got up the nerve to do this.  All my life, I've waited for men to call.  Waited for them to ask me out.  Waited for them to make the first move.  Well, no more of that.  I am finally taking charge of my own destiny. They arrive at the CONCIERGE's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask what room he's in, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buona notte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  Reservation for Faith Corbett, please. He nods, starts punching something into his computer.  Ka pulls something from her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And put it on this. CLOSE on a CREDIT CARD which reads "LAWRENCE CORBETT".  F looks at her.  Kate flashes a wicked smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, could you please tell us what room Mr. Bradley is in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  Mr. Bradley has already checked out. The three cruelest words in existence, "already checked o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelieving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bradley left about a half hour ago.  He said his plans had changed unexpectedly.  Would you prefer an interior or exterior room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't have checked out-- I was supposed to meet him here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry.  Perhaps you misunderstood? He rings for the bellboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying not to panic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you absolutely sure he's gone? Maybe you made a mistake.  You must've made a mistake.  Could you check again?  Please?  Sir? His polite veneer wearing thin, the man pulls a key from honeycomb of slots behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room 217.  Would you like to go up and check under the bed? She doesn't respond.  He replaces it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, which way did he go? The man stares at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody here has any idea which way he went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once they pay the bill, we don't usually follow them. Kate leans across the counter and grabs him by the collar pressing her forehead to his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you don't understand. (like she's possessed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend was supposed to meet him here. He starts to wrestle with her.  Faith steps in to help pr Kate's fingers from the gentleman's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us. He's still coughing as Faith leads her away from the desk the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he was rude. They sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we came all this way and he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave it your best shot.  You tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whimper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost him?... Kate nods sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wait here.  I'm gonna go get us a room for the night. Devastated, Faith stares vacantly into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never meet the man of my dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself as she goes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and the other 99% of the women in the world. As Kate heads back toward the check-in desk, Faith gets u and approaches the DOORMAN.  She pulls the contact lens c from her purse.  Unscrews one side and holds it out in fr of him.  He starts laughing.  She darkens.  He sobers, ra something off in Italian, gesturing toward the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women race along, over bridges, under streetlamps Faith is holding the case out in front of her sister-in-l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just once more, so you'll be sure to know what to look for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith, I've seen it already, okay? If I spot somebody who's got a head that's an eighth of an inch around, standing underneath a tuba, I'll recognize him from the photo. Otherwise, I'm telling you, it's not gonna do me any good. Faith starts stopping people on the street, holding out t case, encouraging them to peer in.  Some of them look at like she's nuts, a few shake their heads, one MAN finally stops.  Examines it carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see him?  Do you recognize him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up, smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candid Camera, right? (he starts waving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it? She snatches it away.  Continues on.  But the crowd jostl her.  She is bumped hard from behind.  And the photo goes floating out into St. Mark's Square.  Frantically, she ge down on her hands and knees, trying to keep people from trampling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fell out. Reluctantly, Kate gets down on all fours, too.  Faith spo the little face lying about two feet away.  She strains t reach out, when a SHOE mashes down on her hand.  It lifts up, taking the photo with it, stuck fast to the sole. Faith struggles to her feet, scooting after the MAN who's moving at a fast clip.  She fights her way through the cr tracing his footsteps, crouched to make sure it's still t He's heading toward the edge of the canal.  Is about to s aboard a gondola, when Faith stands up and grabs his shou from behind.  He turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathlessly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir, I'm sorry, but I think there's something that belongs to me stuck to the bottom of your shoe. Confused, the guy looks down.  Faith reaches for his foot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I just-- She takes the shoe, turns it over, twisting the man's leg knocking him off balance in the process.  Sending him top into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peering down from above)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry... But the shoe is still in her hand.  She turns it over, an sure enough, the tiny image is still perched there.  She a finger and triumphantly picks it up like a crumb. Success...  Until a big gust of wind comes up, whisking t little likeness into the Grand Canal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A puddle of water is forming on the marble floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't like I did it on purpose. Faith is dripping.  Looking like her world has come to an She's holding a phone book, as Kate drops tokens into a p phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't really blame him for being upset.  It was an Armani suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I or did I not offer to have it cleaned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he understood what you were saying.  What's the airport number? A MAID walks by, wheeling a cart.  Suddenly, Faith's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... She takes the receiver from Kate's hand, hangs it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got a dial tone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy at the desk said he only left about a half hour ago, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, maybe his room hasn't been cleaned yet.  Maybe there's something in there that might help us.  Maybe they'll let us go in and take a look around. They both turn to look at the concierge.  Look back at ea other.  Shake their heads.  Kate picks up the phone again Faith takes it from her, hangs it up again.  Looks pleadi at her friend.  Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not breaking into anybody's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wad of LIRE changes hands, as a MAID opens the door to 217.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hasn't been cleaned.  In fact, it looks like a cyclone it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far, I'd say we're looking for a rich slob. Kate stands with her hands on her hips, surveying the sce Faith spots a wastebasket in the corner.  She runs over t it, picks it up, peers in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ha!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (charmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Butterfinger wrapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rich, possibly fat, slob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's fingerprints on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not looking to arrest the man, Faith, we're trying to locate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Right. She drops it.  Starts digging through the wastebasket aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small pile of garbage spread out on the floor -- an app core, a couple more Butterfinger wrappers, some tissue, a empty shampoo bottle, a soap wrapper.  Nothing very helpf There's only one more crumpled piece of paper yet to be examined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This our last hope. She says a silent prayer.  Unfolds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're saved!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (saints be praised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone message. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only, it's in Italian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the phone message and a hand holding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is this?  He owes you money? Pan up to the annoyed Concierge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...  it's just very important that I find him, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's very simple.  When she was eleven years old, she got this name-- Faith elbows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly choking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my brother. Kate looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding back tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my long-lost brother.  See, uh, we were separated when we were very young.  The last time I saw him we were just babies, but I've recently found out that he's here in Italy.  And I'm here trying to find him. That's the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could say I'm sort of looking for my other half. She smiles nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's going to be married in five days, and it would mean so much to her if she could find him before her wedding day. Teary-eyed, Faith nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I ask is that you just call this number and ask if they know him, if they have any idea where we might find him. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then you promise you'll go away? She nods energetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FINGERS DIALING.  As she and Kate wait,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was I gonna do?  Tell him the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ai Monasteri? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Va bene. He's on hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A monastery? Faith is looking stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coolly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a store.  In Rome. She heaves a sigh of relief.  He goes back to the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si.  Sto cercando Damon Bradley?... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si.  Si.  Grazie.  Ciao. Hangs up.  They look at him expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing back the message)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he thinks a woman he works with knows him.  Her name's Anna. But she won't be in 'til tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  How do we get to Rome?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere in Tuscany.  Where the landscape looks like one those old Renaissance paintings.  Undulating hills, sun-dappled olive groves, vast vineyards, crumbling farmhouses.  They speed into the frame aboard a vespa.  F is at the handlebars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the wind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't we just have taken a train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The book said they have a lot of rail strikes in Italy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way we're in control. Besides, look how pretty this is. We're really getting to see the countryside. They speed off.  And a BUG smacks straight into Kate's mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER.  The front wheel of the vespa is rotating very slo That's because they're pushing it.  In silence, until,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you a liter was less than a gallon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would've had enough gas to get us there if you hadn't gotten us lost.  Besides, a kilometer is less than a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  So we should've been able to cover more of them. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, we sure are seeing the countryside, alright. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, no offense or anything Kate, but I think I'm starting to see Larry's side of the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. They plod along again in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing up her hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought all roads were supposed to lead there anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER STILL.  They've stopped to rest.  The sun is beatin down mercilessly. Faith gets up, stands at the side of the road, arm and th extended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know that we should be accepting any rides from strangers. Faith just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expecting somebody you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you don't have to get snippy with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. After a beat,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wounded)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what exactly is Larry's side of the story, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Kate.  I just said that.  I'm sorry.  I'm just on edge. (gazing into the distance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid we're losing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring vacantly ahead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he misses me at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, when Larry and I got married, I thought we were so lucky we found each other so early. People talk about spending their lives together, how many of them really get to?  But maybe I was wrong.  Maybe sooner or later everything wears out. Faith turns to look at her sister-in-law.  She goes over kneels down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember in junior high, when I had that Halloween party?  And we were playing Twister.  And it landed on right-hand-red, and there was only one red spot left.  You reached for  it, but you started to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And instead of taking it, Larry reached out to catch you.  He let you win.  Larry never let anybody win.  That's when I knew.  He was a goner. Kate is idly doodling in the dirt with a twig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what I thought then, Kate?  I thought, I hope someday I have somebody who loves me that much. (a confession)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still hope that. Still looking down, Kate smiles ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you'll find someone who'll let you win at Twister? She looks up, eyes full of doubt.  Faith nods solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went out and bought himself men's cologne the other day.  Did I tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry bought himself cologne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polo. Uh-oh. Faith puts a consoling arm around her, and they sit there the Tuscan countryside.  In quiet contemplation of the capriciousness of life and love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne and Larry are playing.  Larry's clothes are very wrinkled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, she just takes off on me.  No warning.  No explanation.  Just this message on the machine, "I'm leaving you.  Take the clothes out of the dryer."  I mean, what'd I do? Larry smacks the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.  She hasn't seen her since she was a kid, now just because she's dying, all of the sudden she's gotta see her again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been acting weird lately, though.  I shoulda seen it coming. Babbling on and on and on about "communication".  Like I don't know how to communicate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's face it.  Sooner or later we all die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. After a beat, Larry stops the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's dying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your great aunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What great aunt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're walking again, both holding thumbs out now.  And prayers are answered.  A bright red FERRARI comes screech to a halt about ten feet in front of them.  They exchange look.  Faith dashes towards it.  Peers in the window, converses with the driver a moment, then waves Kate over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lugging the suitcase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think this is safe? An interior shot of the car reveals a NUN behind the whee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say so... Kate takes a look inside,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, the Catholic Church is even richer than I thought. She climbs in, and the car PEELS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari zips into the Eternal City.  A wonderland of and history. Baroque fountains spout cool, clear water; kids play socc in the ruins; lovers kiss in secluded corners; elegantly stylish men and women sip espresso in sidewalk cafes, eng in conversations, flirtations, negotiations.  All the wor a stage. They screech to an abrupt halt directly in front of,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ai Monasteri. They get out and are still thanking her profusely, standi at the side of the car with suitcase in hand, when there a whisper from behind,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe in love at first sight? Faith freezes.  Gazes heavenward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like an oath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She turns.  To discover that God is a practical joker.  T guy is talking to Kate.  Slicked back hair, ponytail, a l of leather.  He looks awfully young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (good-naturedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I saw your ring.  This is no problem.  I only want for us to be friends. Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Giovanni. He kisses Kate's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in spite of herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are looking for a place to stay, no, Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Well, I don't know.  Well, maybe.  Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your most lucky day.  My family runs a pension not three blocks from here. What a coincidence.  She looks at Faith.  In spite of her she's a little charmed, flattered by him.  As they contin up the steps,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suggestively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wait here for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, a hushed environment, reminiscent of a monastery. The store sells liqueurs, etc. made by monks.  Faith approaches the counter, behind which one of those inordin fashionable Italian WOMEN is positioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  Uh, do you speak English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (demure smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.  I'm looking for Anna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Anna. Overjoyed, Faith extends a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna, I'm Faith.  You don't know how happy I am to meet you.  You see, I'm trying to find someone, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perusing the merchandise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  My brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetness and light)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother.  Fratello tuo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Right.  Si.  My fratello. And, I was thinking that maybe someone here, well, you, might know him.  His name is Damon Bradley?... The woman's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon Bradley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more thrilled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  You do know him? Anna slams her espresso down on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E' un porco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? She starts ranting in Italian.  Faith pulls out her dicti and starts flipping frantically through it.  Kate comes o with a handful of little bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still flipping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I just asked her if she knew him and all of the sudden--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she saying? Faith shoots her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute-- Kate rushes to the door,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Giovanni... He comes running.  Kate hustles him inside and over to Fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend is looking for her brother and she thinks this woman knows where he is.  Can you tell us what she's saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's saying he's a-- a-- (snapping his fingers, he can't think of the word)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: porco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A porco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (then suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pig!  A pig! (to Faith, apologetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's saying he's a pig. Anna's starting to throw things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very large pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask her if she knows where he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sa dov'e' lui? She screams for about a minute.  He turns to Faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask her if she knows how I might reach him?  If she has a telephone number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha un numero di telefono? She yells some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did, but she... She rips a napkin into shreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...misplaced it. More yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks she's going to meet him at Mezzaluna tonight, but she--

dialogues.speaker: HAH
dialogues.text: She hits her inner elbow with the edge of her other hand, the Italian version of the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...has a prior commitment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's mezzaluna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A restaurant.  In Piazza Navona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ecstatic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  That's it.  That's all I need to know. (to her and Giovanni)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bless you, thank you, thank you. The PROPRIETOR rushes in from the back of the store, make her apologize to the nice customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grudgingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (that's better)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosi va bene. As Faith heads toward the door, she yells after her,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry your brother is a pig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with the bottles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it I pay for these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they emerge from the shop and head down the stairs, Ka is looking skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that proves is that she wasn't the woman who was meant for him. Faith throws her arms around her in celebration, dancing the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
