dialogues.text: And now we know where he's gonna be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON a sign, "PENSIONE DIVINO AMORE".  Giovanni is he them carry their things into the hotel.  He leads them to their room, opens the door.  Faith enters.  As Kate follo he momentarily pulls her aside,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must leave town for two days. Was unavoidable.  But, day after tomorrow, (with import)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I return... He places the key in her hand.  Holding his own there lon than necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is in the shower.  Kate's got an Italian smorgasbor arrayed before her.  Is browsing "How to Make a Man, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on their way out the door, dressed to the nines. Kate turns their key in to the desk, Giovanni whispers in ear,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-eight hours... Nods meaningfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge from a cab into a dreamlike landscape, illumi by the lights Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers and t strolling FIRE-EATERS performing in the piazza.  Everythi seems to be moving in slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the sudden, I'm feeling kind of nervous. (wringing her hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I hate blind dates.  Why couldn't we just have arranged marriages in America?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  At least that way you could spend the rest of your life blaming your parents instead of yourself.  Smile. Faith smiles.  And they enter the restaurant -- a sea of frescoes, flowers, crystal and silver, all awash in candlelight.  "Some Enchanted Evening..." From Faith's POV we see various and sundry men acknowledg or appear oblivious to her expectant face.  A smile here, glance there.  He could be any of them.  Or none of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through her smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get a drink. They take a seat at the bar.  Unbeknownst to them, an extremely handsome MAN at a table on the terrace is eying intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to ask the maitre'd if he's here? It's all come down to this.  A whole lifetime of waiting, searching, hoping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly chicken)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sort of wanted to wait to see if maybe he'd notice me first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've travelled over six thousand miles and now you're gonna play hard to get? The MAN from the terrace is getting up.  Is coming their Kate elbows her.  "Some Enchanted Eeeevening"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a god. He approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I hope you don't think I'm being too forward.  I'm here waiting for a friend, but I couldn't help noticing the two of you. Faith is giddily kicking Kate under the table, but no wor are coming out.  Kate steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We noticed you, too. It's really happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you might be persuaded to join me-- It really is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd love to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending a hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  I'm Guiseppe Romano. Faith's face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're back at the bar by themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's in a name?  I wanna join him.  I don't see why we can't join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.  If he sees me here with another guy, he's gonna think I'm here with another guy.  I just don't want to send any confusing signals. Kate glances back over at him.  Waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Faith)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how come we're always looking for guys for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm the one who's single.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sulking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never even got to be single.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you don't count the sixth grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.  You join him.  But first will you ask if he's here? We watch from a distance as Kate gets up and approaches t MAITRE'D.  He gestures towards a booth on the other side the room.  She thanks him and makes a beeline back to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's heeeeeerrre...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sitting in the fourth booth down, on the left hand side, with his back to us.  He's wearing a navy jacket.  If you turn around, you can see part of his right elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not moving a muscle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he looking at us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing over her shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Faith tries to peek around without being too obvious.  An slips off her bar stool, almost knocking over the drink o the person next to her.  She grabs it, awkwardly climbs b onto the stool.  Then pulls out a compact and checks out view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like she's twelve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooo, I can see his sleeve... After a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I should just go over and introduce myself, huh? Kate nods.  Faith puts the mirror away.  Starts to get up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting back down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do I say I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later.  Having gotten her story straight.  She ge up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right...  Okay.. (suddenly seized with self-doubt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think he's gonna think I'm too aggressive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith.  So far you've trailed the man halfway around the globe.  At this point, I don't think another fifteen feet is gonna tip the scales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Okay...  It's meant to be right? (a deep breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. She straightens her skirt.  Starts to walk toward him aga when,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning anxiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck. Faith smiles gratefully back at her.  Kate motions, "go o Then turns back towards Guiseppe. Faith collects herself. A woman with a mission.  Begins striding purposefully tow him. Focused only on that special arm as, with each step, a li more of it comes into view. Only a few more feet.  There is nothing between her and h now but that WAITER with the enormous tray of pasta comin from the other direction.  But, alas...  In a collision w of inclusion in the "agony of defeat", the tray and all i contents go sliding down over her.  All eyes turn her way and she stands there, paralyzed in an agonizing moment of silence.  Then, with an anguished howl, she dashes to the ladies room.  Kate gets up and goes rushing in after her. And, back out in the restaurant, a pair of feet get up an step gingerly over the remains of somebody's angel hair p Seconds later, with an enormous wet orange spot on her dr Faith bursts out of the ladies room.  And discovers he's The women bolt out the door, just in time to glimpse a ma in a navy jacket disappear down the subway stairs in the distance.  In hot pursuit, Faith flings off her heels and sends them flying.  One of them BONKS a PASSER-BY, anothe MAN clad in a white shirt and carrying a navy jacket, on head.  We may get only a brief look at this guy, but it's enough to establish that while he may not be drop-dead gorgeous, any woman with any sense wouldn't kick him out bed for munching saltines either.   There's an undeniable warmth in his eyes. But Faith doesn't see him at all, because as he bends dow to pick up her shoe, he disappears from sight in the crow and she races madly past him.  Down the subway stairs, in the tunnel-- and into a mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She battles her way through the throng, hopping up and do to try to get an overview, but there is no sign of him. dashes from car to car, pounding on windows, calling out name.  Until, in a sudden whoosh, the doors close, and th train speeds off into the night. But she's still running after it.  Desperately.  Until it finally vanishes around a corner, out of sight.  And she to the ground, arms outstretched in the darkness...  in v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON an abandoned shoe.  A hand picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found one. The two of them are wandering the piazza.  Faith puts the back on and, with one bare foot, limps over to a table. dress is stained, her nylons are run, a few stray noodles still cling to her hair.  Basically, she's a disaster. As they sit down,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, nobody can say we didn't try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not hearing this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's what I think.  We find out what all the subway stops for that train are-- the subway system's really not that big in Rome, we could narrow it down and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not believing this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what, Faith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then... we rent a truck, or a car, either one, and we set up a loudspeaker, and we drive through the surrounding areas, and we page him. Simple as that.  Kate just stares at her, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?...  My hair? When,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the style.  I just don't think this color works for me. They look up.  It's the STRANGER in white with her other in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (reaching for it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow me. He kneels down and places the shoe on her foot.  Then gaz up into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks very much. (back to Kate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think? Kate looks at him.  Kind of charmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was really sweet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant about my idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time we got some professional help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Like a psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly.  How's a psychiatrist gonna find him? He's still kneeling there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to him again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Now go away.  He sits down at a table nearby.  Stares ove at Faith.  She spots an Italian policeman, or CARABINIERE standing at the edge of the piazza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go see what I can find out about speaker rental. She gets up, the STRANGER gets up, as if to follow.  She at him like he's nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Steps around him to head toward the cop.  He sits back do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's the story with your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching her in amazement)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend has lost her fucking mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she doing? Kate turns to him,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's trying to find out where she can rent a loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she can drive through the streets of Rome paging the man of her dreams. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really.  What's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.  She thinks he's here. Even though she's never met him. Even though she's never laid eyes on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still not believing her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. Kate just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well, what's wrong with that? He gazes over at her, gesticulating wildly in the distanc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only... if she's never met this guy, what makes her think he's perfect for her? Kate just shakes her head.  Don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were they pen pals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he some kind of celebrity or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he do some anonymous good deed for her? An exasperated sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got his name off a Ouija board when she was eleven. She holds out her palms.  What can I tell you? A beat.  Then,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is his name?... Faith comes trudging back, in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it would take at least six months to get a permit for a loudspeaker.  And, you have to get the Pope to approve it. Defeated, she picks up her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just go. Kate puts her arm around her and they start walking.  The STRANGER grabs his jacket off the back of his chair.  Tag after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you be staying in Rome long? She doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend said you were looking for someone? (at her side)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I can help you track him down.  I speak a little Italian. And I have a friend who works at the embassy.  Maybe we could-- She's trying to wave down a TAXI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, but I really don't want any help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name?  I'll look into it for you.  I could give you a call. A CAB slows to a stop in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I appreciate the offer, but-- She reaches for the door.  He's standing in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me his name... She blows her nose noisily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to get rid of him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon Bradley. He stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, that's-- I'm Damon Bradley... Still wiping her nose, she notices the jacket in his hand then looks up into his eyes.  The wind rustles through th trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... He nods.  Amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're the biggest mess I've ever seen. She reaches for her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find that very attractive. And she faints.  Dead away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having regained consciousness, Faith is across a candleli table from him.  They're engrossed in conversation.  In e others' eyes.  Tables around them have all emptied.  A wa in the background is trying to prop his eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Coming so close and yet just missing each other.  Do you know what I mean? Does she know what he means...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's this poem by Rilke, I don't remember the whole thing, but it's about that.  About waiting for that person, and wondering if you'll ever find them.  And the last line of it goes, "Who knows?  Perhaps the same bird echoed through both of us, yesterday--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --separate, in the evening..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly, spellbound)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE.   To the Beatles' "I Will" PENSION DIVINO AMORE - Faith hops out Damon's car.  He wa She dashes inside, practically skipping. Moments later, having changed clothes, floats back out an they take off again.  Up above, Kate watches wistfully ou the window. DRY CLEANERS - Dwayne is there trying to pick up his stuf The CLERK is holding out a ticket.  "You have to have one these." THE FORUM - The sun is coming up over the ruins.  Faith a Damon stroll through them.  Damon pulls out a "doggie bag Sets down a little container of pasta for the wild cats t roam Rome. McDONALDS - Rome's golden arches.  Kate is munching on a Mac, and working on a postcard:  "Dear Larry,".  Somebody cruises by her table, snakes out a hand, reaching for her purse.  Without so much as an upward glance, she flicks o a leg and trips him. CAMPO DEI FIORI MARKET - The enormous outdoor market wher everything from orchids, to watermelon, to live eels and octopus are in abundant display.  Damon buys Faith a gard She puts it in her hair. GIOLITTI - A gelateria.  Kate's eating ice cream.  Still working on the postcard:  "Dear Larry".  Nothing more. Finally crumples it up. THE SPANISH STEPS -  Faith and Damon are sitting on the e of the steps watching the street show that is Rome, when LOCAL approaches with a Polaroid.  Selling pictures.  The pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hair's kind of a mess, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair... is perfect. He leans in and kisses her.  And from this angle, except the clothes, they look an awful lot like Rodin's version, the FRAME FREEZES. CLOSE on the photo.  She looks up from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think this is just infatuation, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He takes her hand.  Both a little unnerved, they walk.  U

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...  just to be sure, maybe we ought to shatter each other's unrealistic images of perfection. You know, each of us admit something embarrassing about ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Good idea.  You first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me first?  Alright, well, (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something embarrassing, right? Something we don't want to admit in public. She nods.  He thinks a moment.  Then,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a liberal. She looks at him with amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a liberal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelieving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (solemnly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My car bumper has never held a winning sticker. They gaze deeply at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as long we both know we're going into this with our eyes wide open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lantern-lit street of 18th century facades.  A faint br stirs the trees above.  Strains of opera float out a wind Faith is looking around.  Finally, though they're not overlooking anything,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  This is a really pretty view. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this. He leads her out to the center of the street.  Tilts his back.  She follows and they walk, with their necks craned back, like two drunken sailors, like two kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This... And up above, in the houses and apartments lining either of the street, visible through the unshuttered windows, a gilded ceilings and candlelit vaults of angels.  And beyo those, the star-studded, indigo summer sky. It's all a matter of how you look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's down at the bar, talking to the Italian BARTENDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're saying you think I should call him. He draws a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is your husband, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but...  He was having an affair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si. So what?  He picks up a napkin and sets the glass down on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is, he was sleeping with another woman. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. How much clearer can she make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were having sex. Finally, it dawns on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding gravely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she wasn't my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head in sympathy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (another stab)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your grandmother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, she wasn't a relative, okay? I don't know who she is. Big deal.  He rolls his eyes and dismisses it with a wave his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how much longer 'til Giovanni gets back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all lit up.  And deserted at this late hour.  The wa glows, ethereal blue.  They sit at the edge, bare feet dangling in.  Damon picks up one of her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll have it bronzed. She smiles.  Then sobers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I've been wandering in the desert for as long as I can remember.  With nothing but emptiness around me, wind and sun...  And suddenly, out of the blue, somehow I've found the oasis. He takes her face in his hands.  Solemnly, almost mystica kisses her eyes... her mouth... Until,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one other thing you should know about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing you could say would change the way I feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm engaged.  I'm supposed to be married in two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except possibly that. She gets up.  Heavy with guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, he's a friend of yours.  It's Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne Pinsley.  From high school. That's how I knew you were here. When you called, from the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.  Dwayne. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're engaged to Dwayne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like she's trying to explain an affair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just happened.  I didn't plan it.  I was alone.  And he was... there.  But now everything's changed.  I owe it to him to let him know.  I need to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been more sure of anything in my life. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's find a telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure-- But, before you do that, since we're putting all our cards on the table, I have a confession to make, too. She pauses,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He looks at her worriedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid.  You can tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found each other, didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  We did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright...  this is our destiny. He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Okay, the thing is... I'm not exactly...  I mean-- only in the most literal sense-- I'm not Damon Bradley. The fountain just dropped twenty feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring straight ahead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name isn't Damon Bradley.  I just told you it was Damon Bradley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (numbly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Peter Wright. He heaves a sigh of relief.  Draws her to him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, am I glad that's over with. She's frozen.  He's noticing this.  Until she extricates herself from his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a feeling this was gonna be a problem. (to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're upset, right? She shoots him a look.  Starts putting on her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything else is true.  I swear. I am a liberal.  I do live in Boston.  I am a zoologist.  I did see "Local Hero" fifteen times. I am single.  I don't believe in Scientology and I don't smoke. But, okay, I admit it, mea culpa, I lied about one little thing. She runs out to the street.  Starts waving for a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One little thing?  You call your identity one little thing? Following after her,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never lied? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said whatever it was you would understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was before I found out what it was. A taxi approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait--  Let's put this in perspective.  You're going to let a few little letters keep us apart? No response.  The cab stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grasping at straws)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if the name's that much of a problem, why don't you just call me that?  It'll be my nickname. She opens the taxi door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the brink of tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do this to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on...  What kind of an excuse is that? And this time, the door SLAMS in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab pulls up.  Faith gets out, drags into the hotel, looking shell-shocked.  From the bar, Kate spots her and rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Faith are both at the bar, staring off into the distance.  Getting bombed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Sociopaths.  They're able to figure out what you want them to be and then they act like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how could he know?  He only just met me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men have ways. Kate shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a drag.  You finally meet the man of your dreams and he turns out to be a pathological liar. Faith wails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still busy?  Okay, can I leave another message, please? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, the message is, would she rather have the wrong guy with the right name or the right guy with the wrong name? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-- no, no.  They alternate, see? It's the wrong guy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the receiver, off the hook.  Faith is in bed, wi awake, staring mournfully up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is on her way out the door.  She opens it-- to find outside in the hallway, carrying a bouquet of flowers the of a refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving past her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She went out to check into skywriting.  I can't believe you lied.  Is this a genetic thing, men will say anything just to get laid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  That's not fair.  That's not it at all.  Look, something somewhere got screwed up.  Maybe some metaphysical wires got crossed.  I may not have the right name, but I was there.  I'm the guy.  I'm-- skywriting?? She eyes him skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't think this would be a problem? He starts pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an emergency.  I only lied that night because it was the only way I knew to stop her.  I knew if I didn't, I'd never see her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good strategy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know I wasn't even supposed to be in Rome?  My boss was supposed to come to this conference, and at the last minute he got the measles.  The measles. Who gets the measles at forty-three?  So they sent me. And I wasn't supposed to be in that piazza that night either.  I'd gone to the movies, only it was sold out.  So I was wandering around. Just wandering...  When I got hit in the head with this shoe. He gazes out at the Roman skyline,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I saw her.  And all I know is, when I looked in her eyes I saw something... light.  And life and passion and yearning.  And something else I can't even put my finger on, something I'd never seen before--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mania.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.  And I thought, please God, give me a sign, give me some way to keep this woman from getting into that taxi and disappearing from my life forever.  And He did. She told me the name.  Granted, it wasn't my name, but it was a start. He turns to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if that's not destiny, I don't know what is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really romantic. She places a consoling hand on his shoulder,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad she hates your guts. Starts leading him toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a name for chrissakes. The whole thing is so ludicrous. For all she knows, this guy could be the biggest loser on the face of the planet.  He could have a criminal record. (throwing up his hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could think Ronald Reagan was a great president. Kate shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, realistically, what are the odds that this is a terrific guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten billion to one. Beat. There's a KNOCK at the door.  She opens it.  It's Giovann -- with a single rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess who-oooo... He sees Peter and the other flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giovanni, this is Faith's friend, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello. (to Kate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came by to see if you wanted to join me for a drink, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to. She heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  You've got to help me. She considers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is strapped into the passenger seat of a miniscule two-seater.  White-knuckled.  Staring wide-eyed out the w at a faint trail of vapor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the roar of the engine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure people are gonna be able to read this?... The pilot nods.  The plane goes into a dive.  Faith's eye roll back in her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Giovanni are at a table, overlooking the domes o the city, bathed in the honeyed late afternoon light. Giovanni's pointing out the sights.  A plane buzzes overh Kate looks up.  Some faint gibberish is being scattered t the wind.  She shakes her head.  Giovanni takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have to be getting back to work? His eyes sparkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's siesta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, in America they care for work, they live to work.  But in Italy, they care for food, for love, for pleasure... His lips graze her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do the years matter?  I've known you for centuries...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith enters.  Her hair looking like she stuck her finger a light socket.  She's handed an enormous stack of messag Peter, Peter, Peter, etc.  There are a lot of cross-outs. She forces herself to drop them into the trash on her way the stairs.  Then opens her door and sees the flowers.  S fingers one, momentarily softening, then turns resolute. pulls her suitcase from beneath the bed and is unzipping when Kate enters, grinning from ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi-iii...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Where've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sightseeing... (sobering as she realizes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I've been kidding myself. Because I realized you were right from the beginning.  This whole thing was just a wild goose chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you've had a little bad luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little bad luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, a lot of bad luck.  But that means the odds are probably in your favor now.  This is no time to give up. Faith smiles wanly.  Starts pulling stuff out of drawers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they read kids fairy tales in the first place?  Children are very impressionable, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're just quitting?  Just like that? Faith pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were the one who didn't think I should've come in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a ouija board, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and a fortune teller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, obviously it wasn't meant to be.  I've got forty-eight hours.  I can still make it home in time to marry Dwayne and try to forget any of this ever happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Peter?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter?  Peter was a mistake.  An imposter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last dead end in a long series of dead ends that I am relieved to finally be leaving behind. (glancing up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May as well start packing, our cab's gonna be here in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said I was going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just not ready to go home quite yet, that's all. There's a tap at the door.  Giovanni pokes his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready, Kate?  Oh, hi, Faith. Did you do something different to your hair? Kate shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He promised to take me on a tour of the fountains... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't have to go. Faith looks at the two of them.  Realizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, you go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you'll be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.  And Kate, thank you for coming.  Thank you for being such a good friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squeezing her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back before you leave. She and Giovanni exit.  Faith picks up the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long distance operator, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings.  The answering machine picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hi, it's Dwayne.  Don't be a heel, leave a message." Beep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Dwayne.  It's me.  I'm just calling to say I'm on my way home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith's eyes drift to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The situation here is looking pretty hopeless.  I guess she's given up. (catching herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, it's Flight number 966.  It gets in at one tomorrow.  I'll see you then. Click.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is taking the same walk that was so magical the nig before.  But it's not the same.  She takes a few steps, t her head back, and-- trips.  She's holding her foot in pa when,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate told me you were going home. Is that true? She looks up, sees Peter.  Turns around and starts limpin briskly back towards her hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tagging after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're limping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I'm limping.  I stubbed my toe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?  You want some help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are leaving, aren't you? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you just tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's any of your business, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?!  To be married, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the foot doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He stops in front of her.  Looks her straight in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping around him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I know who Dwayne is, and he's reliable and stable and wants to marry me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?!  Is there something wrong with loving somebody who's safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he love you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to marry me, doesn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't answer my question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you asking me this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'd like to think at least one of you feels that way.  Does he  know who you are? He touches her arm.  She pulls it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (utterly serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stubbed your toe, don't you think that's a sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a podiatrist.  Pain is your body's way of telling you something is wrong.  Your toe is trying to tell you not to do it. She rolls her eyes, continues limping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be something I can do, something I can say to make this up to you?...  Just tell me what it is, I'll say it.  I'll do it. I don't want you to hate me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening, she stops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Peter, I don't hate you. But what we had was an illusion. Mutual wishful thinking.  We both wanted to believe it for awhile, but it was all founded on a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it wasn't real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the oasis in the desert? Are you telling me that was a lie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that wasn't a lie.  That was... (almost more to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a mirage. She looks at him.  Then, softly, sadly,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see?..  We're not the ones who are meant to be. (earnestly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the man of somebody else's dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't have the right name?! She starts walking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going home.  I never should've come here in the first place and I'm going home. He calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Okay.  Forget me.  Leave me out of it.  But don't go throwing your life away on somebody you don't love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she turns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says I don't love him?... A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.  Well then, go home.  Get married.  I hope you'll be very happy. And he walks quickly away, disappearing into the shadows. She starts to call after him, but he's already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is waiting in the lobby as a CAB pulls up outside. watch from a distance as she hugs Kate goodbye.  The DRIV comes in, picks up her bag, and she drags out the door be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is staring forlornly out the car window as the driv gets in, turns over the engine.  They're pulling away whe SOMEONE runs out into the street, arms waving madly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running alongside the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go. The cab is speeding up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because.  I know where he is. It SCREECHES to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's helping her bring her things back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went back to that restaurant and I spoke with his waiter, just on an off chance, you know, and, anyway-- he knew the name of the guy's hotel.  So, I called there, they said he left yesterday.  But, apparently he comes here every year, always follows the same route.  He always goes from here down the coast to the Le Sirenuse hotel in Positano.  I called.  And they told me he's checked in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Positano?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in the south.  I've still got my rental car.  I can get you there by morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, I don't think that would be a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know there's no going back for us.  That's not it.  I just want to make this up to you.  Clear my relationship karma.  And I know the area, I've got some cousins down there.  Please.  Let me do this for you.  Let this be my gift to you. She searches his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because-- I want you to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answering machine is recording Faith's message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne, you're still not there?... I was really hoping we could talk. (more) DAMON (Cont'd) (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell you she's made an unexpected recovery, but she's a little confused and she needs me to stay here one more day.  Just to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter found him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Isn't that amazing? Kate looks over at him.  He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's down in someplace called Positano.  Peter says we can make it there by morning. As they head out the door, Peter turns quietly to Kate,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relishing this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's travelling with his mother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They speed down darkened the highway, Faith and Peter in front seat, Kate and Giovanni in the back.  The wind in t hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy at the hotel told me he always wears a gold medallion, and usually has a book or magazine with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself, encouraged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes to read... (to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he mention anyone in particular? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I'd rather not say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd really rather not say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  I need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey Spillane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little unnerved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey Spillane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Hustler. The car shoots down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive past sheer cliffs dropping off to silvery rock azure seas, transparent depths.  Around hairpin turns ski the Gulf of Salerno, before finally winding into the impossibly beautiful seaside town of Positano.  An enchan land of steep hillsides overgrown with lemon trees, jasmi bouganvilla...  cliff hanging villas... emerald and sapph grottoes...  cerulean skies...  heaven on earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another "Lifestyles" hotel.  An elegant old villa perched above the village and the deep blue sea.  The four of the head for the desk, where Kate cheerfully plunks down Larr credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan Collins stayed here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to concierge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Damon Bradley here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si.  A la piscina. He gestures towards the terrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out by the pool right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and I forgot to tell you.  He's here with his mother. She checks her hair, starts adjusting it in the reflectio of a window.  Then peeks around the corner. ANGLE ON a MAN reclining on a lounge chair.  We start at feet which don't quite reach the end of the chair.  Move the legs, past the pot belly, to, sure enough, an enormou gold medallion resting on his chest.  A fringe of hair sk the perimeter of his head -- and his back. A copy of Mickey Spillane's latest rests on a table next him.  He's lying back, eyes closed.  This is Damon Bradle This is Him... Peter smiles broadly.  Faith's face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him?! Faith elbows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the guy you've been waiting for all these years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eating this up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you gonna go introduce yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not particularly anxious to)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. She doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to do it?

dialogues.speaker: NO.
dialogues.text: She takes a good look.  Swallows hard.  Reluctantly approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... He doesn't look up.  She stands awkwardly over him, looki back at Kate for support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-hem, excuse me, hello... He cracks one eye, squints up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in my sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopping out of the way)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Sorry. He closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me, but... He squints up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like an idiot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the time? He eyeballs her like she's some sort of curious life form

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like I'm wearing a watch? He doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I guess not.  I just thought maybe-- When someone at the edge of the pool calls out,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Damon. But the person she's talking to doesn't respond.  Instead somebody else, another MAN who'd been doing laps in the p emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? This is no ordinary mortal, this is a living monument to mankind.  He could've modeled for Michelangelo.  Mel Gibs feels like Jo-Jo-the-Dog-Faced-Boy next to this guy.  The in the Calvin Klein ads-- okay, let's say he looks like o of those guys. Kate's eyes shift to Peter, who suddenly sobers. Back at the pool, a LITTLE KID is talking to Damon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for letting me borrow this. The kid sets the Spillane tome back on his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. He gets out and starts toweling off, a halo of sunlight glistening off his tanned, muscular body; reflecting in t deep green pools of his eyes.  She grabs hold of a nearby chair as her knees start to give way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Damon Bradley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Oh. My. Goddd. It's now or never.  She takes a deep breath.  Lets it out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. It's never.  She goes running back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatareyoudoing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spinelessly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he doesn't like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means you're a completely worthless excuse for a human being, and the fates have all conspired to make you miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God... you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith, I'm kidding. (stopping her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this how you plan to get what you want from life?  When you finally find it, you turn and run away from it? She gazes fearfully back out to the terrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if she doesn't wanna meet him, she doesn't wanna meet him. Kate glares at him.  Takes Faith by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have overcome everything it took to get here.  Every obstacle to reach this moment.  This fateful moment.  Now, it's in your hands. She points toward the terrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you want? Is this a trick question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's picking up his things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi again... He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perfectly friendly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously fingering her necklace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure is. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been here long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just since yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got here, too.  Not yesterday.  But, just now.  Today. Just a few minutes ago. (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we just got here...  I mean, I just got here.  I'm single. He looks at her.  Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chickening out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll probably be seeing you around, then. She starts to skulk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so. She pauses, turns,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering... (not looking at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have dinner plans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her eyes tentatively meet his)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not exactly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you be willing to have dinner with me? A slow smile creeps across his lips.  Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (somehow maintaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would?  Really? He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Okay, how about I meet you at the restaurant at the base of the stairs at, say, 8:30? A smile that would melt Nome in January,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll look forward to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backing away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Good.  See you then, then. She's about to trip over a chaise lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to tell me who you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Faith.  My name's Faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending a hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pleasure to meet you, Faith. He takes her hand.  Kisses it.  Peter rolls his eyes. She turns around and dashes back inside.  We hear an ear-splitting SHRIEK of excitement come from inside the h Damon smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet-setters have Sardinia, this is a resort with bohe roots and small town charm.  A barber sets his chair in t street outside his shop.  A workman is polishing the bron mermaid out in front of "Siren Travel". "Two Gentlemen from Verona" is being performed at the community theatre.  Housewives open shutters, shopkeepers sweep storefronts of fruit stands, pottery and linen shop Men carry armloads of flowers, boxes of lemons and gleami fish to market.  Children play at the edge of the sea. Mayberry in Italy. Kate and Giovanni are down at the beach, frolicking in th water. And Faith is strolling through town, floating on air.  Sh spots a dress in a clothing store window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith emerges from a dressing room in something summery a flowing.  She looks beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jar of green goo.  Faith's plastering one of those gree clay masks to her face.  Her dress is hanging on the door She's got rollers in her hair.  She and Kate are getting for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see his eyes?  I've never seen eyes that green.  And he was so nice.  Did you see how nice he was?  He was really nice. There's a KNOCK at the door.  She freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were meeting him there? Panicking, Faith dashes to the bathroom, starts frantical rinsing off the mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. Kate opens the door.  It's Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's you. (to Faith)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... Relieved, Faith steps out from behind the bathroom door, wiping green stuff off her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in. He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  You found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found him.  I don't know how to thank you. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it looks like we both lucked out.  I just met somebody myself. Somebody my aunt introduced me to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's a knock-out, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good.  Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, that's why I came by.  I need to fix this button.  Do you have a needle and thread? This is pretty transparent, but she politely plays along. As she starts looking through her stuff, he starts idly fingering their toiletries.  Smells her perfume, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're going to dinner? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?  Just-- out of curiosity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to that place down at the bottom of the stairs.  Nothing fancy. She hands him the needle and thread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks. (really trying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heartfelt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. As he exits,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gracious and indebted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Peter.  Thank you so much. He nods and leaves.  She looks at Kate. Faith emerges from her room and starts down the steep hil stairs that lead to the village.  Lights along the shore beginning to glitter; a warm breeze flows in like silk. the sort of moment and sort of place where all dreams see within reach. Down below she can see him waiting for her outside the restaurant door.  She pauses a moment to take it all in. looks up and sees her.  Blows a kiss up to her.  She practically swoons. As she arrives at the foot of the stairs, he takes her ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like a goddess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A open-air place, overlooking the sea.  Waves crash. Moonlight glistens on the water.  Guitarists stroll by, singing sentimental Neopolitan ballads.  It's all almost good to be true.  They're led to a table and he pulls out chair.  The perfect gentleman.  A WAITER comes over to we them.  Asks if they'd like a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Faith)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wine? She's a little giddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the waiter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brunello di Montalcino, '85, please. Back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I noticed you out at the pool even before we spoke.  I could sense the chemistry between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little flustered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bedroom eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITER arrives with the wine.  Pours.  She raises a g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, to-- new friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And more... They toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I guess you're probably wondering why I asked you to dinner... He sets down his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.  Happens to me all the time. An awkward laugh.  It probably does.  Damon picks up his scans the prices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, fuck me. She must be hearing things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. (clearing his throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prices are a little steep here, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.  You're my guest. She picks up her menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What looks good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perusing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmmm... Well, the scampi sounds good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like shrimp?  I like shrimp. Small world. They're still pondering their options when another COUPLE stroll in and are led to the table directly next to their It's Peter and his date, FRANCESCA.  And this time he was telling the truth.  She's stunning.  All suntanned legs a skintight spandex.  Beaming, he pulls out her chair.  Fai just stares at him.  As he moves around the table to sit his eye catches hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hissing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were hungry. She turns her back on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up from his menu)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, the scampi sounds good to me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon.  There you are. An ELEPHANT OF A WOMAN approaches, Damon waves her over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Faith)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think you'd mind... She proceeds to plant herself at their table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith, this is my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, this is Faith. Trying to conceal her surprise, Faith politely extends a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Mrs. Bradley. Peter drops his napkin, leans over towards Faith to retri it,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering into her ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mommy"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER.  Their food has arrived.  Francesca is rubbing Pet leg under the table.  Faith is trying to ignore this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you say you've been to Italy before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few times.  It's kind of an annual tradi--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Damon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me, but could we borrow your salt? Faith glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. He hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Damon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, that looks tasty.  What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chewing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scampi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon.  Not with your mouth full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scampi, huh?  I love scampi.  I practically always get it in these seafood places.  Is that good scampi? Damon nods.  Swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to try some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased with himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  I'll trade you some of my pasta. They start cheerily exchanging portions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER STILL.  The candles have burnt low.  The plates are being cleared.  Francesca and Peter are feeding each othe dessert.  Giggling.  Damon snaps his fingers at a waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El checko, por favor. Annoyed, the WAITER totals up their tab and starts to han it to him.  Damon motions towards Faith.  She takes it, s pulling out lire as he and his mother get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, I saw where they had motor boats for rent down in the harbor. Why don't we all go for an evening cruise around the bay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if that's such a--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great idea! Faith is still counting as Damon and his mother, Peter an Francesca all head for the door.  She finally finishes, hurries to her feet to catch up with Peter,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at his side)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to keep an eye on you.  The guy's a total stranger, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So were you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, no hard feelings.  You found somebody.  I found somebody. I thought we could double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Giovanni are dining outside on the vine-covered terrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is back when I was in school, you take those tests, you know? They said I should go into physical therapy. (he takes a bite)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or wood-working. She looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good with my hands. The phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold that thought. Kate goes inside to pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith at a pay phone outside the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate.  Thank God you're there. I need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh...  Okay, we'll be there. How is he, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith glances over at Damon -- as he pinches a woman walk by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still a little too early to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Giovanni are here.  Damon's mother is in the cor Snoring.  Damon is pontificating on global policy to Pete

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irregardless of the politics.  It's time we stopped dicking around. I'm telling you, nuculear is the only way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't you think that's a little short-sighted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, to Faith)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only is he a momma's boy and a fascist, he says "nuculear" and "irregardless".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's perfect, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he is living proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think maybe you've been right.  I think I may have been too critical in the past. Damon BELCHES loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith, if I may say so, you picked a helluva time to come to this realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human rights, shmuman rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hope springs eternal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I can change him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was supposed to be the one guy in the world you wouldn't need to change. They stare over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if I kiss him I'll feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe it'll turn him back into a toad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER.  Francesca is idly running her fingers through Pet hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what about books?  You like Hemingway?  You gotta love Hemingway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sun Also Rises.  For Whom the Bell Tolls.  The Old Man and the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alright.  For a closet homo. Faith's jaw muscles tighten slightly as she tries to take in stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about music?  You like classical?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boston Pops.  Season tickets. Damon yawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how about those old romantic movies with those great stars, huh? Like Audrey Hepburn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I think I prefer Katherine Hepburn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey was cool. Finally.  She smiles.  Damon SPITS noisily over the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad she didn't have any tits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is listing things.  Faith and Damon are nodding thei heads, yes and no.  Never in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baseball.  Carmelcorn.  Organized religion.  Sting.  Grape-flavored candy.  The Marx Brothers.  Long foreplay.  Gardening.  Drum solos. Dogs.  Mai tais.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, checking her list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing.  With the exception of fruitcake, which, let's be honest, everybody hates, (looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you two have absolutely nothing whatsoever in common. (re-checking her list)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's got to be almost statistically impossible. Francesca and Peter are up towards the bow of the boat, cavorting, hanging on each other.  Faith is facing them, her back to Damon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not wanting to look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing now? Kate peers over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's tearing the wings off a moth and making it walk around. Faith buries her head in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is standing at the railing alone, gazing out at the ocean.  When she feels someone sidling up next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what are we waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's face it.  You want me. He places a hand on her breast.  She lets out a blood-cur SCREAM.  Peter comes running to her rescue.  Hauls off an decks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Giovanni are forcibly dragging Damon off the bo down the dock.  Still onboard, she and Kate watch them go in a daze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (numbly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  He is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent my whole life waiting for a creep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came all the way to Italy in search of a weasel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still watching them go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you could've found one in America. Francesca steps past them off the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not feel bad.  He was scum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the men are out of earshot, we see Peter pull this aside.  And surreptitiously hand him an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't think that last bit with the bugs was a little over the top?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.  You were perfect. Handing him another envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thank Mrs. Walker, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith and Kate are still there, unloading a groggy Mrs. Bradley.   She goes tottering down the dock, as Peter ret

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess he turned out to be kind of a loser, huh? She sighs, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like the world's biggest idiot. He finishes securing the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should you be embarrassed? He was the jerk. She doesn't believe this, but appreciates the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In spite of the way it all turned out, though, I want you to know how much I appreciate your helping me find him.  I would always have wondered what might have been. He pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, was the least I could do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was more than that.  It was very generous of you.  It was very kind. His eyes meet hers.  From the landing, Francesca calls af him impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better go. Faith's eyes shift between the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  I understand. He touches her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me you won't leave without saying goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Course not. And with that, he gets up, steps off the boat and heads d the pier with Francesca clinging to him.  She watches the walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  I guess I've got a wedding to go to. Faith steps off the boat and walks down the pier, a solit figure, who finally disappears in the mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is packing.  She picks up her "Let's Go Italy" guid and the polaroid of her and Peter falls out.  "The Kiss". She sighs.  Tucks it back inside the book.  She picks up wallet, opens the coin purse, reaches in to pull out her ENGAGEMENT RING.  As she does, something else falls to th floor.  Dwayne's DRY CLEANING TICKET.  She stares down at Then takes the ring, places it back in her wallet.  And p up the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mother is sobbing hysterically.  Larry is there.  Dwa is there.  Leslie is there.  Leslie's eyes meet Dwayne's meaningfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Giovanni are walking down the pier, hand in hand He stops her, leans her up against the railing, and plant a massive kiss on her.  After she's managed to catch her breath,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giovanni, I want to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thank you. He goes to kiss her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't understand.  It's been wonderful meeting you.  But... I have a husband.  I have two kids at camp.  I have a life I have to go back to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to go if you don't want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do want to. He realizes where this isn't going.  Tries another tack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm just one of those Italian Casanovas.  The guys who try to seduce every woman who comes their way.  Who prey on unhappily married women.  Who lure unsuspecting--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giovanni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what you are. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it that obvious? She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
