dialogues.text: Thank you for making me feel wanted. She turns, and heads up the stairs.  Alone.  After a beat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. She looks back down,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my pleasure. And he starts down the street.  Passes an outdoor cafe. an attractive woman in it.  ANGLE ON the WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe in love at first sight?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is in bed.  In the darkness.  The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't expect you back so soon. Kate closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I realized, if you're getting married, you're gonna be needing the maid of honor, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, no.  There's not going to be a wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I ought to be getting home anyway.  The kids'll be back from camp soon.  The house is probably a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Larry?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Larry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I've just been thinking... maybe this destiny thing is more of a do-it-yourself operation.  Maybe the things that are meant to be are the things we want badly enough to fight for. The room is quiet.  You can hear the waves in the distanc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a glorious morning.  Birds chirp.  The sea shimmers the distance.  Faith is standing outside a hotel room doo She takes a deep breath.  Knocks.  It opens.  Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Are you... busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you're leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I just came by to apologize. He looks at her questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems like ever since I found out about this guy, this name, I've been kind of crazy.  Like I was on drugs or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...  Well, anyway, I also wanted to tell you, I'm not getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aren't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I mean yes, I'm not.  I decided to call it off.  Well, actually, it was kind of mutual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, since I have a few more days of vacation left, I was wondering if maybe you'd want to do something sometime.  I mean, you know, if you don't have... other plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking me out? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case... no... She looks down at the ground.  Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have other plans. She looks back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate goes to the desk for her key.  The concierge hands i to her, along with something else.  An envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From an admirer... She hesitantly opens it.  Inside is a college catalogue. note:  "Please turn to page 51".  Puzzled, she opens it t page 51.  The Sociology section.  A class is circled: "Trans-gender Modes of Communication in Post-Modern Socie And another note in the margin: "You want to take it with LARRY steps into view from around a corner.  She looks up Tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Faith are overlooking the sea, towards Capri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't come to Southern Italy and not see the Blue Grotto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need to run up and get my bathing suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I'll meet you at the dock in ten minutes. As she dashes off,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is on her way back to her room.  She passes the community playhouse where two teenage kids are up on ladd suspending a banner across the stairs announcing a new pl "The Odyssey".   One kid accidentally drops his end, and goes fluttering down across her path.  Faith stops to ret it and is handing it back up to him when she glances at t window where the eight-by-tens of the play's stars are be changed.  The new star of the show is noneother than Damo Bradley.  Only his name isn't Damon Bradley.  It's LEONAR GILINSKY.  She stares at the photo.  And suddenly has tro breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is waiting at the dock.  Checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is packing.  Furiously hurling stuff into a suitcas Peter shows up at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something the matter?

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT
dialogues.text: Backing behind it,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd call that a yes. (peeking around the corner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I get a hint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a hint?  I'll give you a hint.  You are the lowest, most despicable, most reprehensible form of reptilian swine--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reptilian swine.  There's no such thing.  Reptiles aren't swine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?!  You hired an actor??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. (a nervous beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one had to tell me.  He's starring in the local play. A bead of sweat rolls down his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did, didn't you?  You got somebody to pretend to be him? Tell me the truth.  For once. He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  The truth is... I thought we had something here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you did that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I can't believe you are so stubborn and so blind as to let some stranger, some phantom you've never even met destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the reason I never met him. You knew it was the thing I most wanted in life and you sabotaged it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sabotaged it?  You're the one who lost him, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I might've found him again if I hadn't left Rome to make this pointless trip down here with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I recall, you were on your way home.  And I didn't want you to go so, yes, I told you a little white lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "little white lie"?  A "little white lie"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would call it-- unforgivable. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think you're overreacting just a little here?   We're talking about love, okay?  Let's be rational.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rational?!  Love is not rational! Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing up his hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I'm crazy.  You have driven me crazy.  No one in their right mind would go to this much trouble to win over someone as insane as you.  Did it ever, even for one second, occur to you how much work it was to set all this up?  How many arrangements had to be made? How many players had to be coordinated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I'm flattered.  What an incredibly romantic gesture. Cancel the roses, I've decided to lie to her instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it isn't.  I called off my wedding all because of you. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing this herself for the first time)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Then,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is the thanks I get.  I did you a favor.  You never wanted to marry that joker in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point. (realizing she's just given herself away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if I had wanted to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had wanted to, you'd have gone home. Then, more calmly,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I just thought if you finally got rid of this obsession with this name, if you could get it out of your system once and for all, then maybe you'd be able to stop waiting and open your heart to someone real.  Granted, ideally, me.  I didn't do it to hurt you.  I did it for you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it for us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no us. His eyes harden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's right.  There's only him.  Mr. Perfect Imaginary Man. You know, I gave you more credit than you deserved.  The truth is, you're in love with the fantasy. You're afraid of something real. And he storms out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a pile of cornball souvenirs.  A little gondola. A little colosseum.  The little liqueur bottles. Kate and Larry are at a table.  She's been collecting thi for him all along the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?  All that stuff was for you, Kate.  It just seemed like you were mad at me, so I thought maybe if I-- I hate Polo... Kate smiles.  In love with him all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's just one thing I still don't understand. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a great aunt in Italy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, carrying his suitcase, turns in his key to the concierge. Signs his bill.  And resignedly exits out the ANGLE on the mermaid out in front of "SIREN TRAVEL".  Ins Faith is waiting in line.  She steps up to the window.  O the other side of the counter is Damon.  That is, is Leon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little uneasy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you start picking your nose, I know he put you up to it. He looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the moth stuff that gave it away, didn't it? (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew that was too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you gave a very convincing performance.  And you'll be pleased to know that your eight-by-ten glossy is now on display at the local playhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My picture's up? He conveys this to a co-worker in Italian.  They exchange high-fives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glumly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this is what you do?  I mean when you're not playing other parts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it things didn't work out between the two of you? She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a shame. She shrugs.  Heh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... Anyway, I'm here to pick up my ticket.  TWA, Flight 877. He starts punching it into his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your first trip here? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an amazing place, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoking or non-smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Non. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of history.  For example, did you know, according to legend, this coastline used to harbor Sirens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful women who could lure men to their destruction with their singing.  Nobody's ever really seen them and lived to tell about it. But, I don't know.  An awful lot of ships wrecked on those rocks. He shrugs.  Hands her her ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  Have a good trip. She nods.  Distant.  And we stay on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter places his suitcase in the car.  Gets in.  Tosses something out the window.  A dead gardenia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Larry.  Larry starts choking on his Campari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon Bradley?  That's why you're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  You know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a joke.  I was pushing the arrow.  I wanted to get to the next question.  I wanted to find out who was gonna win the Series.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying you just made the whole thing up?  The guy never even existed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He existed.  He was some kid I knew from Little League. (musing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a real jerk. (he looks up at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say he's a friend of Dwayne's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Went to high school with him. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: what about the fortune teller?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CARNIVAL NIGHT
dialogues.text: Twenty years ago.  A young Faith is sitting across from t fortune teller.  There's a pounding at the back door. This time we stay with Madame Divina, following her as sh gets up, marches to the back of the booth and throws open door.  Standing there is Larry.  He whispers something in ear as he hands her a five dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought she'd get a kick out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a harmless little prank. Who in the world would've thought she'd spend her life waiting for this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, you've got to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell her.  She's called off her wedding.  She'll never speak to me again. He looks up pleadingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell her. Faith bounding up the steps.  She races to Peter's room. Pounds on the door.  No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith dashes to the desk, runs into Kate and Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry!  What are you doing here? (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom sent you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He puts an arm around Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came after the woman I love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He missed me. Faith smiles.  He puts his other arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women I love.  How are you, Faith? She's a little surprised by this outpouring of affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. (to Kate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.  He told me what happened.  He just left for the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, did you rent a car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith.  Larry has something he wants to tell you about Damon Bradley. Larry is violently shaking his head "no".  Kate jabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave you two alone. She exits the room.  Stranding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, can I borrow your car keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith, this guy you think is Mr. Right, he's... not what you think--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it's a long story, but I know who he is.  I know where to find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Faith--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Larry.  I have to hurry. She spots the keys lying on the table.  Grabs them, bolts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bring it back as soon as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Faith--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?... Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chickening out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the red Fiat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Faith's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she knew where to find him, and then she grabbed my car keys, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't tell her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't give me a chance. Kate pins him with her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you never know... (lamely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they'll hit it off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is yanking Larry into a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean we have to stop her before she does something crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith goes screeching around a curve.  A few beats later, TAXI follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith speeds through the tangled web of Roman traffic.  K and Larry in close pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith screeches to a halt in the passenger loading zone. Dashes inside.  Scans the DEPARTURE SCREEN for a flight t BOSTON.  Finds it: AMERICAN AIRLINES, GATE NUMBER 7, "ON TIME", at 5:00.  She checks her watch.  It's 4:57.  She s racing down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aboard the plane, Peter is settling into his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vending machine.  SOMEBODY at it with his back to us pu the Butterfinger button.  The "SOLD OUT" light blinks on. A FIST starts banging on machine.  Faith sprints by. Oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith rushes to GATE #7.  Slaps something down on the des in front of the CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boarding pass. Blows past him.  He sticks out an arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you're too late, m'am. She stops.  Breathing hard.  Uncomprehending.  He looks a the pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this isn't for this airline, either. Faith turns to the window to see the portable stairs once again being pulled away from the cabin door.  Deja vu.  S notices a side door.  Only this time there are MEN with MACHINE GUNS standing guard directly outside it.  This, a all, is Rome. With her hands pressed plaintively against the glass, she watches as the plane taxis away from the gate toward the runway, to join the LINE-UP of other PLANES waiting for take-off clearance.  This jet, which we'll call "Peter's" is fifth in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Larry come barrelling in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith is buying one of those little portable Igloo ICE CH With an "I    Italy" logo.  And an enormous roll of MASKI TAPE. A JET takes off.  Peter's jet moves up a notch.  Three to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the ICE CHEST.  With a lot of tape wrapped aroun it.  And large lettering, "MEDICAL EMERGENCY" "DO NOT OPE And a little red cross.  It looks pretty tacky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heart transplant?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  She's been waiting a long time. The clerk picks up the ice chest, starts trying to examin it.  Faith stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I can't let you do that. Hearts are very fragile. Somebody else comes up.  A SECURITY GUARD.  He and the cl start conversing Italian.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW --
dialogues.text: Faith sees another jet take off.  Two to go.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE --
dialogues.text: Faith is anxiously looking from one authority to the to o vainly trying to follow their conversation.  Finally the turns to her,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the cardiologist. The Clerk eyes the ice chest suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have that with you before. (to the guard, pointing to the chest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prima non l'aveva con se.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was late in arriving. (with import)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any I.D.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've given you my credit card, my passport number.  I've paid for the flight.  Now, while you two sit here cross-examining me, someone's future is hanging in the balance.

dialogues.speaker: OUT ON THE RUNWAY --
dialogues.text: The last jet in front of Peter's is given clearance.  It down the runway and disappears into the sky.  And Peter's taxis into position.  ENGINES REVVING furiously.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE --
dialogues.text: A whole flock of AIRPORT PERSONNEL are now conferring.  A crowd of other ONLOOKERS have gathered.  A few of them st mumbling opinions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a heart, for godssakes.  You guys are Italian.  Don't you get it?  It's the greatest gift one human being can give another.  Are you telling me you're going to stand there and deny her the chance of a lifetime? A GUY in the crowd with a "Dianetics" book in one hand an a cigarette in the other, tosses in his two cents,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the nut go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, I'm afraid we've got a temporary delay.  We have a medical emergency and are going to have to head back to the gate. Passengers groan.  The engines wind down, and the plane t off the runway, back toward the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The portable stairs are being wheeled back toward the cab door.  Faith is waiting inside.  Triumphant.  When,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon Bradley.  Signore Damon Bradley.  E pregato di recarsi all'ufficio informazione. For a moment, for just a fraction of a second, she hesita

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon Bradley.  Mr. Damon Bradley, please meet your party at the information booth. Then we see the decision has been made.  Ice chest in han she strides confidently out the door toward the plane, wi a backward glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Larry are waiting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry Corbett? Larry turns, It's the smoker with the "Dianetics" volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that was you. (he extends a hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon Bradley.  Remember me? He calls to a woman nearby,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey... (to Larry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my wife, Arlene. (to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry and I played in Little League together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith walks up the steps and through the cabin door.  She spots Peter seated about halfway back.  But he doesn't se her.  He's staring blankly out the window.  She makes her to the open seat next to him.  He looks up.  Does a doubl take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you something.  Something I didn't want you to leave without. She sits down.  Hands him the ice chest.  Puzzled, he ope the cover.  Inside is a little chocolate heart.  He takes out, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping for the real thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you that, too. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do know you're insane. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love that in a woman. And the plane takes flight.  As we,
